SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.nec.nle.siafu.model
Class Agent

java.lang.Object
  de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Agent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Trackable, Comparable<Agent>
public class Agent
extends Object
implements Trackable, Comparable<Agent>

Instances of the Agent class represent the simulations Agents. Agents on auto are handled by the behaviour model, and go about their pre-programmed routine. Information intrinsec to the agent can be added by using the set(String, Publishable) method. Each agent can be queried for its context using the getContext(String) method, which will return any of three types of inromation, all as instances of the Publishable class:

  • Information that's intrinsec to the simulation, such as the agent's position or destination
  • Publishable objects that have been stored in the agent's info field
  • The value of an overlay at the agent's position

Author:
Miquel Martin
See Also:
BaseAgentModel

Constructor Detail

Agent

public Agent(Position start,
             String image,
             World world)
Create an Agent using a place where he will first appear on day 0, and his appearance. The name is automatically generated using the SequentialNamer class. The zPriority is set to 0;

Parameters:
start - the place where the agent starts its life
image - the image name that represents the agent. This is the portion of the image name before the hyphen provided in the sprites directory of the simulation data.
world - the world that the agent belongs to. It has to be the same for all the agents in the simulation.

Agent

public Agent(String name,
             Position start,
             String image,
             World world)
Create an Agent using a place where he will first appear on day 0, and his appearance. The name is automatically generated using the SequentialNamer class. The zPriority is set to 0;

Parameters:
name - the agent's name
start - the place where the agent starts its life
image - the image name that represents the agent. This is the portion of the image name before the hyphen provided in the sprites directory of the simulation data.
world - the world that the agent belongs to. It has to be the same for all the agents in the simulation.

Agent

public Agent(String name,
             Position start,
             String image,
             World world,
             int zPriority)
Create an Agent using a name, a place where he will first appear on day 0 and his appearance. Note that the initial destination of the agent is set to his starting place.

Parameters:
name - the agent's name
start - the initial position of the agent
image - the image name that represents the agent. This is the portion of the image name before the hyphen provided in the sprites directory of the simulation data.
world - the world that the agent belongs to. It has to be the same for all the agents in the simulation.
zPriority - an integer that determines the layer where the agent is drawn, should there be more than one agent on the same spot. A high priority means that the agent will be on top, a lower one means he'll be at the bottom. The values are arbitrary and depend only on the relative value between your different agents.

resetAgents

public static void resetAgents()
Resets the info fields that are statically frozen into the agent. This is required when a simulation is loaded without restarting the virtual machine.

getZPriority

public int getZPriority()
Get the Z Priority of this agent. A High value means the agent will be drawn on top. A low value means he might be drawn on by other agents in the same position.

setZPriority

public void setZPriority(int zPriority)
Get the Z Priority of this agent. A High value means the agent will be drawn on top. A low value means he might be drawn on by other agents in the same position.

setImage

public void setImage(String image)
Change the appearance of the agent to that given by image.

Parameters:
image - take the filename of the sprite image you want to use out of the ones given in the simulation. The image name is the part of the filename before the "-"
Throws:
UnexistingSpriteException - if the image is not available in this simulation

getDestination

public Place getDestination()
Get the destination of the agent. The returned place might be a temporary one, not defined in the world model. This occurs when the GUI or the external command interface have been used to move the agent somewhere.

Returns:
a place for which the agent is headed, or null if the agent is already at his destination.

Set the speed at which the agent will move. A speed of n means that the agent will move n grid positions in an iteration.

Parameters:
speed - an Integer number with the number of grid steps to walk at every iteration

getDir

public int getDir()
Get the direction in which the agent is currently facing.

Returns:
a number between 0 and 7 (both included) representing the direction, where 0 is north, and the rest follow clockwise (NE is 1)

setDir

public void setDir(int newDir)
Set the direction in which the agent should face.

Parameters:
newDir - a number between 0 and 7 (both included) representing the direction, where 0 is north, and the rest follow clockwise (NE is 1). Numbers outside this range will be modulo-ed into correctness.

public void setPos(Position pos)
Set the position of the user. This method provides instant teleportation!

set

public Publishable set(String key,
                       Publishable value)
Sets a key-value pair in the info field of an agent. Note that while you can change the value of a key at any time, adding keys is not allowed after the createAgents method has been called; this ensures that the keys remain constant once the simulation starts.

Also note that when a new key is added to the info field, you must provide a value for every agent. This guarantees that each agent contains has the same information.

Specified by:
set in interface Trackable
Parameters:
key - the key being added to the info field
value - the value associated to the key
Returns:
the old value associated to the key, or null if there was no value
Throws:
InfoFieldsLockedException - if the create agents method has already returned, and it's therefore not possible to add new fields

getInfoKeys

public static Set<String> getInfoKeys()
Get a set containing the keys in the info field of the agents. Note that the keys in the info field of all agents must be the same, and have a non null value, for the simulation to run.

Returns:
a set with the keys in the agent info field. This keyset is not backed by the keys in the info fields themselves. Changes on this set have no effect in the agent's info field.

checkAllInfoFieldsPresent

public boolean checkAllInfoFieldsPresent()
Check that this agent instance has all the fields specified in the static INFO_FIELDS. This ensures that all agents have exactly the same fields set.

Returns:
true if the agent has all the fields from INFO_FIELDS set, false otherwise

getInfoValues

public Collection<Publishable> getInfoValues()
Get a collection containing all the values in the info field. Unlike getInfoKeys, this collection is backed by the info field itself, so that changes to it will affect the agent info field.

Returns:
a Collection with the info values in the agent

get

public Publishable get(String key)
Get the value of the given key from the info field of the agent.

Parameters:
key - the key whose value we want to retrieve from the info field
Returns:
the value of the given key
Throws:
InfoUndefinedException - if the key doesn't exist in the agent's info field

turn

public void turn(int turn)
Turn the agent turn times 45 degrees. A turn parameter value of 4 will make the agent turn around 180 degrees.

Parameters:
turn - a number representing the number of times to turn 45 degrees

moveTowardsDestination

public void moveTowardsDestination()
Move n steps towards the agent's current destination, where n is the speed. The direction of the movemement will be that which gets the agent closest to the destination. For more information on the routing mechanism, see Gradient.

moveInDirection

public void moveInDirection(int moveDir)
                     throws PositionUnreachableException
Move the agent one step in the direction provided by the dir parameter.

Parameters:
moveDir - the direction in which to move
Throws:
PositionUnreachableException - if the position where the agent would end is a wall.

moveTowardsPlace

public void moveTowardsPlace(Place place)
Move n steps towards the provided place, where n is the speed. The direction of the movemement will be that which gets the agent closest to the Place. For more information on the routing mechanism, see Gradient. Callinc this method does not affect the agent's current destination.

Parameters:
place - the destination place.

wanderAround

public void wanderAround(Place place,
                         int radius,
                         int soberness)

Makes the agent wander around the given place. In detail, the agent will wander around as in wander(int), until he gets farther away than radius grid positions from place in which case it will move towards place as in to true. This is to avoid the default behaviour about heading for the Destination overriding the AgentModel command to wander somewhere.

Place(Place)

Note that making an Agent wander also sets the atDestination flag to true. This is to avoid the default behaviour about heading for the Destination overriding the AgentModel command to wander somewhere.

Parameters:
place - the place to keep close to
radius - the distance in grid points (Background pixels if you will) to keep as dog-leash length
soberness - how straight the person is going to walk
See Also:
wander()

wanderAround

public void wanderAround(Place place,
                         int radius)

Makes the agent wander around a given place with a soberness of 5. This method is equivalent to calling wanderArdound(place, radius, 5).

Note that making an Agent wander also sets the atDestination flag to true. This is to avoid the default behaviour about heading for the Destination overriding the AgentModel command to wander somewhere.

Parameters:
place - the place to keep close to
radius - the dog-leash length
See Also:
wanderAround(Place, int, int)

wander

public void wander()

Makes the agent wander with a predefined soberness of 5.

Note that making an Agent wander also sets the atDestination flag to true. This is to avoid the default behaviour about heading for the Destination overriding the AgentModel command to wander somewhere.

See Also:
wander(int)

wander

public void wander(int soberness)

Makes the agent walk randomly. In this random pattern, the agent moves one step per iteration, and then turns with a probability of one out of soberness times. The more sobber, the less times it will turn. If it does turn, there's an equal probability that it will turn left or right.

If the current direction of the agent takes him towards a wall, the agent will turn, much like a toy robot, 135 degrees at a time, until a free direction is found. If the agent is in a one pixel wide room, it will loudly complain about it.

Note that making an Agent wander also sets the atDestination flag to true. This is to avoid the default behaviour about heading for the Destination overriding the AgentModel command to wander somewhere.

Parameters:
soberness - the likelyhood that the agent turns in its random wandering. One out of soberness times, it will turn.

getContext

public FlatData getContext(String ctxName)
                    throws UnknownContextException
Returns a context variable in FlatData format. Notice that this does not only apply to the agent's info data, but to anything on the simulation. With this method you can retrieve the following variables: The context variable can be one of three types:
  • The name of an overlay as defined in the simulation data
  • The name of one of the variables in the agent's info field, defined at the agent model upon creation
  • A simulation intrinsec variable. These are called: Name, Time, Position Destination and atDestination

Specified by:
getContext in interface Trackable
Parameters:
ctxName - the name of the variable
Returns:
a FlatData object representing the requested data
Throws:
UnknownContextException - if the context variable isn't known

returnControl

public void returnControl()
Return the control of the agent to the simulation. The agent will obey the next order coming from the agent model.

getControl

public void getControl()
Get the control of the agent, that is, keep it from obeying the will of the agent model.

isOnAuto

public boolean isOnAuto()
Find out if the agent is being controlled, or is working automatically according to the agent model. An agent is being controlled when its getControl() method is called. This is at least done implicitly by the GUI upon clicking on the agent.

Returns:
true if the agent is moving according to the agent model, false otherwise

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Find out wether the agent is currently being drawn by the simulation GUI.

Specified by:
isVisible in interface Trackable
Returns:
true if it is visible, false otherwise

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
Set whether the GUI should draw this agent, or rather make it invisible. Note that an invisible agent can not be selected in the GUI, and that any track mark on it will also be ignored.

Specified by:
setVisible in interface Trackable
Parameters:
visible - true if the agent should be visible, false otherwise
